The following activities are automatically logged for audit purposes: • User authentication and authorization events • Security group membership changes • Analytics rule creation, modification, and deletion • Data connector configuration changes • Playbook execution and automation runs • Incident status updates and assignments • Workspace configuration modifications • RBAC and permission changes

This document establishes comprehensive technical and administrative controls for protecting audit log information in Microsoft Sentinel deployed on Azure Government Cloud. These controls ensure audit logs cannot be modified, deleted, or tampered with by unauthorized individuals, including system administrators, while maintaining forensic integrity for investigations, compliance audits, and incident response activities in accordance with federal requirements.

column1: Procedure for Continuous Data Collection Health Monitoring.docx
column2: Use the Data collection health monitoring Workbook template to gain deep insights into the workspace data ingestion status, including anomaly detection.
column5: Procedure for Continuous Data Collection Health Monitoring.docx

column2: This policy establishes requirements for correlating audit records from multiple sources across the information system environment to support the investigation and response to indications of unlawful, unauthorized, suspicious, or unusual activity. Effective correlation enables security personnel to identify patterns, track attack progression across systems, and conduct thorough security investigations.

column1: Policy Audit Reduction and Report Generation 3-3-6.docx
column2: This policy establishes requirements for audit record reduction and report generation capabilities that support on-demand analysis and reporting of security-relevant audit information. These capabilities enable security personnel to efficiently analyze large volumes of audit data, identify security events of interest, and generate reports for security investigations, compliance reviews, and management reporting.
column5: Procedure Audit Reduction and Report Generation 3-3-6.docx

column2: This policy establishes requirements for comparing and synchronizing internal system clocks with authoritative time sources to generate accurate and consistent time stamps for audit records. Proper time synchronization is critical for audit trail integrity, incident correlation, investigation accuracy, and multi-factor authentication functionality across the organization's information systems.

This document establishes comprehensive technical and administrative controls for protecting audit log information in Microsoft Sentinel deployed on Azure Government Cloud. These controls ensure audit logs cannot be modified, deleted, or tampered with by unauthorized individuals, including system administrators, while maintaining forensic integrity for investigations, compliance audits, and incident response activities in accordance with federal requirements
